author: julianfoad
msg: On the tree-conflicts branch, merge outstanding changes from trunk
up to r32172. (merge_tests.py 77 and 93 now fail as well as the eight others
that were already failing.)
### A bad merge! Unfortunately, whatever I did in this merge increased the
### number of files that differ from /trunk:
### from 52 (diff --summarize /trunk@31822 /branches/tree-conflicts@32255)
### to  233 (diff --summarize /trunk@32172 /branches/tree-conflicts@32256)

author: sbutler
msg: Corrections to the tree conflict detection design note.
* notes/tree-conflicts/detection.txt
Clarify use cases 1 and 2.  Correct a note in the example
of a deep tree conflict.

author: hwright
msg: Remove a line which snuck in during conflict resolution in r32251, and
subsequently led to a build error on 1.5.x.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/getlocationsegments.c
(svn_ra_serf__get_location_segments): Don't call
svn_ra_serf_error_on_status(); it hasn't been backported to this branch.

author: hwright
msg: Merge the following group from trunk:
Fix issues #3220 (log -g is slow) and #3235 (log -g is wrong).
Justification:
Slowness is bad -- in some tests, this fix decreased the cost of a log -g
run from about 6 minutes to around 12 seconds.  And the old code only
gets slower as more instances of mergeinfo appear in the repository.
Wrongness is bad -- and I don't even need to explain this.
Notes:
When merging r32153, use the "theirs" version of all conflicts which
appear to be in the new functions fs_mergeinfo_changed() and
get_combined_mergeinfo_changes().  "--accept theirs-conflict" did the
right thing for me (cmpilato) as of r32155.
Votes:
+1: cmpilato, pburba, hwright
+1: jerenkrantz (r32237 only)

author: hwright
msg: * STATUS: Add vote for r32237, moving to approved.
